p: Most of the California precipitation increase occurs during DJF, where the entire region shows an increase of 0.94 mm day −1 century −1, with a range from ∼0 to 1.9 mm day −1 century −1. As with the annual mean, precipitation increases from south to north-by 0.34 in southern California, 1.0 in central California, and 1.51 mm day −1 century −1 in northern California, all significant at the 99% confidence level. Also included in Fig. 1 is the percentage of realizations that yield an increase or decrease in precipitation. Grid points for which 25 out of 40 realizations (∼65%) agree on sign pass a binomial test to reject the null hypothesis of equal probability of positive or negative sign at the 95% confidence level. During DJF, all but a handful of CA grid boxes (those in the southeastern corner) pass this test, indicating a high degree of consistency across realizations.
